including two subpackages: duke.command and duke.task for command and
task-related classes respectively.

Implement JavaFX GUI
commitResults.messageBody:
Add a simple JavaFX GUI inspired by the Duke tutorial's chatbot layout.
Removed most text UI related elements from project and re-did logic to
use the new GUI instead of the text UI (commands executed now return a
String instead of directly getting the UI to print them).

commitResults.messageTitle: Edit JavaDoc to remove text UI references and refactor MainWindow
Change Parser to adhere to code quality guideline
commitResults.messageBody:
The Parser.java file contains a parse() method that parses the commands
input by the user into the chatbot. However, it is a very long method
and could be split up.

The if-else syntax is replaced by a switch-case syntax with minor
modifications to the logic to accommodate this syntax (should not be
noticed by users with normal use). This improves code readability.

Additionally, most multi-statement code is replaced by more private
static methods within the Parser class to ease readability of the
parse() method even more.

This fix in code quality was inspired and spearheaded by the comments
in this PR: https://github.com/nus-cs2103-AY2324S1/ip/pull/288

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor LocalDateTime formatting
commitResults.messageBody:
Formatting for LocalDateTime is expected to be consistent for the entire
program when displayed to the user in the GUI.

By introducing a new Formatter utility class with a single static method
formatDateTime, it reduces the amount of clutter within the methods
in which they are used. This also ensures consistency in the formatting
of LocalDateTime as String objects within the GUI.

In addition, removed unnecessary this.* references from methods when
referring to instance fields.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add JUnit test cases for duke.util.Formatter
Merge pull request #1 from brein62/branch-A-CodeQuality
Add assertions to Parser and MainWindow
commitResults.messageBody:
To ensure that certain private methods will only be run in certain
scenarios, assertions are used to enforce a precondition at the start
of

Parser class: Ensure that the different commands parsed, as handled by
different private methods within the Parser class only happen when the
message starts with the corresponding command message. For example,
only inputs starting with 'mark' can trigger the parseMarkCommand()
private static method in Parser and return a MarkCommand object.

MainWindow class: Ensure that the handleExit() method is only run if the
user specifies and types "bye". Checks if the input message starts with
"bye".

Gradle is also configured to handle assertions in this commit.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge pull request #2 from brein62/branch-A-Assertions
Add stream functionality to TaskList
commitResults.messageBody:
To improve performance to the TaskList, the pure ArrayList
implementation of TaskList has been changed to a more generic java.util.
List implementation, which also allows for more functional code through
Streams.

Within the TaskList, the getSavedStrings() and find() methods have been
modified to use stream implementation. Additionally, a new constructor
for TaskList based on Stream<Task> has been created.

Other changes:
- Change test files and other classes to fit the new implementation of
  TaskList that doesn't solely rely on ArrayList anymore
- Change other files to adhere to Checkstyle

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge pull request #3 from brein62/branch-A-Streams
Add update and clone functionality
commitResults.messageBody:
The ability to update and clone tasks without deleting them or adding
the details all over again helps the user to improve the ease of use of
the application.

By adding the update functionality, tasks can now be updated using
simple commands such as `update 4 msg Hello World` or `update 3 Deadline
2023-10-10T12:34:56`. This updates the message and deadline for the
tasks respectively. This is done by making the Tasks more mutable and
allowing for updates to be directly done to the task.

By adding the clone functionality, users can add Tasks based on another
task without having to specify the task all over again. This may be
helpful for recurring tasks or related tasks.

These implementations are for the extension **C-Update**.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add JUnit test cases for Update, Clone and Find
Merge pull request #4 from brein62/branch-C-Update
Improve colour appearance in GUI
commitResults.messageBody:
The chatbot so far does not distinguish between error responses by the
bot and regular responses. When there is an error response, a dark red
reply will be shown by the bot. Dark red is chosen to improve contrast
and thus readability of the chatbot.

The background colours are changed to improve distinction between the
bot and the human input. The bot has a default colour palette (same as
background) while the human input has a silver colour palette.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix imports to adhere to Checkstyle
Merge pull request #6 from brein62/branch-A-BetterGui
Add detection to ensure Event start is before end
commitResults.messageBody:
With the previous implementation, Event end date/time can be set to be
before the start date/time. With this detection in place, when creating
or updating an Event, there is a check in place to ensure Event from
date/time is before Event to date/time. This check is done in the
constructor, when updating using the `update()` method, as well as when
cloning the Event.

commitResults.messageTitle: Improve error handling when parsing Events
commitResults.messageBody:
Previously, when the parser parses an event command, the parser will
disregard the logic of /from and /to markers within the event command.

This fixes the issue and ensures that exactly 1 /from and 1 /to marker
is present in the event command and a few JUnit test cases under
parseEvent have been added.

JUnit test cases:
- 2 /from: DukeException thrown
- 2 /to: DukeException thrown
- /from and /to flipped: accepted and event is flipped as needed
